sentence.Network_en: When depressed, they dramatically overindulge in chocolate and sweets.
sentence.Network_cn: 情绪低落的时候，她们就疯狂地猛吃巧克力和糖果。

sentence.Network_en: Tourist numbers from across the pond have dropped dramatically.
sentence.Network_cn: 来自大西洋彼岸的游客数量已急剧减少。

sentence.Network_en: She bowed dramatically. "Anastasia Krupnik, at your service," she said.
sentence.Network_cn: 她夸张地鞠了个躬。“阿纳斯塔西娅·克鲁布尼克，随时为您效劳，”她说。

entry.tran: 突如其来的;急剧的;引人注目的
entry.def: A dramatic change or event happens suddenly and is very noticeable and surprising.

example.ex: A fifth year of drought is expected to have dramatic effects on the California economy...
example.tran: 第五年遭受旱灾预计会对加利福尼亚的经济产生巨大的影响。

example.ex: This policy has led to a dramatic increase in our prison populations.
example.tran: 这项政策已经让我们监狱的囚犯人数激增。

entry.tran: 激动人心的;引人注目的;令人印象深刻的
entry.def: A dramatic action, event, or situation is exciting and impressive.

example.ex: He witnessed many dramatic escapes as people jumped from as high as the fourth floor...
example.tran: 他目睹了许多人从五层高的楼上跳下来逃生的惊险场面。

example.ex: Their arrival was dramatic and exciting.
example.tran: 他们的到来令人激动不已，难以忘怀。

entry.tran: 戏剧的;有关戏剧的;戏剧学的
entry.def: You use dramatic to describe things connected with or relating to the theatre, drama, or plays.

example.tran: 大学里戏剧艺术专业的学生

example.ex: I had no thoughts of making a dramatic film. I was working in documentary.
example.tran: 我没想过要拍一部剧情片，我正在拍一部纪录片。

sentences.sentence: "the play was dramatically interesting, but the direction was bad"

auth_sentence.content: The tarmac delay rule has dramatically curbed lengthy strandings.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tarmac delay rule has dramatically curbed lengthy strandings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tarmac delay rule has dramatically curbed lengthy strandings.

auth_sentence.content: Not that he would see it quite so dramatically.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not that he would see it quite so dramatically.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not that he would see it quite so dramatically.

auth_sentence.content: Which made us unhappy and made no sense dramatically.
auth_sentence.res_content: Which made us unhappy and made no sense dramatically.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Which made us unhappy and made no sense dramatically.

stems_affixes.word_buile: basic基本的+ally……地→adv.基本上,主要地
synthetic合成的+ally……地→adv.综合地,合成地
systematic系统的,体系的+ally……地→adv.系统地,有规则地

Sentence.sentence: Printing with moveable type on paper dramatically reduced the cost of producing a book compared with the old-fashioned ones handwritten on vellum, which comes from sheepskin.
Our risk of cancer rises dramatically as we age.

The way in which Mr Jobs revived the failing company he had co-founded and turned it into the world's biggest tech firm (bigger even than Bill Gates's Microsoft, the company that had outsmarted Apple so dramatically in the 1980s), sounds like something from a Hollywood movie
Better irrigation can dramatically improve crop yield and about 40% of the world's food supply is currently derived from irrigated land.
This varies dramatically depending on crop, from three calories for plant crops to 35 calories in the production of beef
whites' attitude towards blacks has dramatically changed

means.word_mean: 戏剧性地;引人注目地;显著的

sentences.en: His tone changed dramatically when he saw the money.
sentences.cn: 当他看到钱时，说话语调发生了戏剧性的变化。

sentences.en: Our way of life has changed dramatically over the last ten years.
sentences.cn: 在过去10年里我们的生活方式发生了巨大的变化。
